name: Python Development Guide
description: Internal best practices and guidelines for Python development
guide_content:
# Python Development Guide

## Setup
```bash
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## Coding Standards
- Follow PEP 8
- Use type hints
- Write docstrings
- Add unit tests

name: Postman API Testing
description: Complete API development and testing environment
guide_content:
# Postman API Testing Guide

## Quick Start
1. Download and install Postman
2. Create a new collection
3. Add your API requests

## Testing APIs
- Use GET, POST, PUT, DELETE methods
- Add authentication headers
- Write test scripts in JavaScript
- Run collections with Newman CLI

## Best Practices
- Organize requests in collections
- Use environment variables
- Add pre-request scripts
- Document your APIs

name: Git Workflow Guide
description: Internal git branching strategy and best practices
guide_content:
# Git Workflow Guide

## Branch Strategy
- `main` - Production-ready code
- `develop` - Integration branch
- `feature/*` - New features
- `bugfix/*` - Bug fixes
- `hotfix/*` - Urgent production fixes

## Common Commands
```bash
# Create feature branch
git checkout -b feature/your-feature develop

# Commit changes
git add .
git commit -m "feat: add new feature"

# Push to remote
git push origin feature/your-feature

# Merge back to develop
git checkout develop
git merge --no-ff feature/your-feature
```

## Commit Message Convention
- `feat:` - New feature
- `fix:` - Bug fix
- `docs:` - Documentation
- `refactor:` - Code refactoring
- `test:` - Adding tests

name: Data Pipeline Documentation
description: Internal documentation for ETL data pipelines
guide_content:
# Data Pipeline Documentation

## Architecture
Our data pipeline follows the Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pattern.

## Pipeline Stages
1. **Extract** - Pull data from source systems
2. **Transform** - Clean and process data
3. **Load** - Store in data warehouse

## Access Internal Pipeline
Navigate to: `\\bosch-internal\data-engineering\pipelines`

## Configuration
```yaml
source:
  type: postgresql
  host: db.internal.bosch.com
  database: production

destination:
  type: snowflake
  warehouse: analytics
```

## Monitoring
- Check pipeline status at `/internal/pipeline-monitor`
- Review logs in `\\bosch-internal\logs\data-pipeline`

description: Internal team documentation and knowledge base
guide_content:
# Confluence Best Practices

## Creating Pages
1. Navigate to your space
2. Click "Create"
3. Choose a template
4. Add content using editor

## Tips
- Use page hierarchy for organization
- Add labels for searchability
- Link related pages
- Keep pages up to date

## Internal Links
- Team Space: `/display/TEAM`
- Project Docs: `/display/PROJECT`

name: Test Environment Access
description: Access internal testing environments and test data
guide_content:
# Test Environment Guide

## Available Environments
- **DEV**: `https://dev.internal.bosch.com`
- **QA**: `https://qa.internal.bosch.com`
- **UAT**: `https://uat.internal.bosch.com`

## Access Credentials
Contact IT team for VPN access and credentials.

## Test Data Location
Network path: `\\bosch-internal\test-data\qa`

## Database Connections
```
DEV DB: dev-db.internal.bosch.com:5432
QA DB: qa-db.internal.bosch.com:5432
```

## Important Notes
- Never use production data in test environments
- Reset test data weekly (every Monday)
- Report issues to qa-team@bosch.com

name: ML Platform
description: Internal machine learning model training and deployment platform
guide_content:
# ML Platform Guide

## Platform Access
Navigate to: `https://ml.internal.bosch.com`

## Training Models
1. Upload your dataset to `/data/training`
2. Define model configuration
3. Submit training job
4. Monitor training progress

## Model Deployment
```python
from ml_platform import deploy

model = deploy.load_model('model-v1.0')
model.deploy(environment='production')
```

## Resources
- GPU Cluster: Available 24/7
- Storage: 10TB per project
- Documentation: `\\bosch-internal\ml-platform\docs`

## Support
Contact: ml-platform-support@bosch.com
